parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the consumer waits for a response before it times out.

parameter.name: serviceUrl
parameter.description: Base URL of the service on Salesforce Marketing Cloud to access from the connector. All other endpoints are derived from this base URL.

parameter.name: proxyConfiguration
parameter.description: Proxy configuration for the connector.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: The socket connection timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #connectionTimeoutUnit.

parameter.name: connectionTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #connectionTimeout

parameter.name: tlsContextFactory
parameter.description: Protocol to use for communication. When using `HTTPS`, the HTTP communication is secured using TLS / SSL. If `HTTPS` is configured as the protocol, the user must configure at least the keystore configuration in the tls:context child element of this listener-config.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: clientId
parameter.description: The OAuth client id as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: clientSecret
parameter.description: The OAuth client secret as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: tokenUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's token endpoint URL

parameter.name: scopes
parameter.description: The OAuth scopes to be requested during the dance. If not provided, it will default to those in the annotation

parameter.name: objectStore
parameter.description: A reference to the object store that should be used to store each resource owner id's data. If not specified, runtime will automatically provision the default one.

operation.name: createAsset
operation.description: Creates a draft of a new asset in either JSON or MIME format.

parameter.name: assetType
parameter.description: Asset type.

parameter.name: asset
parameter.description: Asset to create.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

parameter.name: readTimeoutTimeUnit
parameter.description: Time unit value for the *Read Timeout* field.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createEmailSendDefinition
operation.description: Creates a long-living send definition object that references the email template, subscriber list, sending options, journey, and metadata.

parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operation.name: createEventDefinition
operation.description: Creates an event definition (name and data schema for an event) and defines an event definition key. The resource uses this key when firing an event to send it to the appropriate journey. Typically, marketers create the event definition in the Journey Builder UI. Use this resource instead if you're using a custom application for Journey Builder functionality. To call this resource, assign your API Integration the Automation | Interactions | Read scope.

parameter.name: eventDefinition
parameter.description: Email send definition to create.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

parameter.name: readTimeoutTimeUnit
parameter.description: Time unit value for the *Read Timeout* field.

parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteAsset
operation.description: Deletes an asset.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: ID of the asset to delete.

parameter.name: isCdnDelete
parameter.description: Permanently deletes the file and its URL in Akamai when the associated file is deleted in Content Builder. A value of `1` permanently deletes the file. An unspecified value or a value of `0` does not permanently delete the file.

parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

operation.name: deleteEmailSendDefinition
operation.description: Deletes a message definition. You cannot restore a deleted definition. The deleted definition is archived, and the response provides a delete location of the definition key for reference. You can reuse a deleted definition key because the information associated with the deleted definition key is copied to a new unique identifier.

parameter.name: definitionKey
parameter.description: Definition key to delete.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

operation.name: sendEmailMessageToMultipleRecipients
operation.description: Sends a message to multiple recipients using a send definition. You can provide a messageKey in the request; otherwise, the messageKey is automatically generated in the response. The limit is 2000 recipients per request. If you send attributes with the recipients, we recommend no more than 500 recipients per request.

parameter.name: sendEmailRequestBody
parameter.description: Email send definition to create.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

parameter.name: readTimeoutTimeUnit
parameter.description: Time unit value for the *Read Timeout* field.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: sendEmailMessageToSingleRecipient
operation.description: Sends a message to a single recipient via a send definition using a *Message Key* path parameter.

parameter.name: messageKey
parameter.description: Unique identifier used to track the message status. Can be automatically created when you create a message or can be provided as part of the request. Can be up to 100 characters, and there are no restricted characters. Each recipient in a request must have a unique *Message Key*. If you use a duplicate *Message Key* in the same send request, the message is rejected.

parameter.name: emailRequestBody
parameter.description: Content of the message to send.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

parameter.name: readTimeoutTimeUnit
parameter.description: Time unit value for the *Read Timeout* field.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: sendEmailMessageUsingTriggeredSendDefinition
operation.description: Sends transactional email using Marketing Cloud's triggered send functionality.

parameter.name: triggeredSendEmailBody
parameter.description: Content of the message to send.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

parameter.name: readTimeoutTimeUnit
parameter.description: Time unit value for the *Read Timeout* field.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The ID of the event definition expressed in the form of a GUID (UUID). Required if not using a key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key of the event definition. Required if not using an ID.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: sendSmsMessageToMultipleRecipients
operation.description: Sends a message to multiple recipients using a send definition. You can provide a messageKey in the request; otherwise, the messageKey is automatically generated in the response. The limit is 2000 recipients per request. If you send attributes with the recipients, we recommend no more than 500 recipients per request.

parameter.description: Content of the message to send.

parameter.name: messageKey
parameter.description: Unique identifier used to track the message status. Can be automatically created when you create a message or can be provided as part of the request. Can be up to 100 characters, and there are no restricted characters. Each recipient in a request must have a unique *Message Key*. If you use a duplicate *Message Key* in the same send request, the message is rejected.

operation.name: triggerEvent
operation.description: Fires the entry event that initiates the journey. If you use UTF-8 characters in a payload for the Rest API, change the Content-Type header to: application/json; charset=UTF-8.

operation.name: unauthorize
operation.description: Deletes all the access token information of a given resource owner id so that it's impossible to execute any operation for that user without doing the authorization dance again

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

operation.name: updateEventDefinition
operation.description: Updates an event definition by ID or key. Once an event definition is created, only a few properties can be updated. To call this resource, assign your API Integration the Automation | Interactions | Read scope.

parameter.name: definitionOption
parameter.description: Definition key to delete.

parameter.name: updateEventDefinitionBody
parameter.description: Event definition to update.

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description: Read timeout value. Used to override the read timeout values defined in the connector configuration.

parameter.name: readTimeoutTimeUnit
parameter.description: Time unit value for the *Read Timeout* field.

parameter.name: config-ref
parameter.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Hostname or IP address of the proxy server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Port of the proxy server.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username to authenticate against the proxy server.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password to authenticate against the proxy server.

parameter.name: nonProxyHosts
parameter.description: List of hosts against which the proxy must not be used.

parameter.name: ntlmDomain
parameter.description: Domain to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The ID of the event definition expressed in the form of a GUID (UUID). Required if not using a key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The key of the event definition. Required if not using an ID.
